Module yae.accelerometer

User input from accelerometer (works only on mobile devices).

An accelerometer measures the acceleration of a device on three axes. From this acceleration one can derive the tilt or orientation of the device.

Acceleration is measured in meters per second per second (m/s²). If an axis is pointing straight towards the center of the earth, its acceleration will be roughly -10 m/s². If it is pointing in the opposite direction, the acceleration will be 10 m/s².

Functions

getX () Get current X relative to the center of earth
getY () Get current Y relative to the center of earth
getZ () Get current Z relative to the center of earth
getRotation () Get current X, Y and Z relative to the center of earth
isAvailable () Checks if accelerometer is available on current device


Functions

getX ()
Get current X relative to the center of earth

Returns:

    number x value of accelerometer

Usage:

    x = yae.accelerometer.getX!
getY ()
Get current Y relative to the center of earth

Returns:

    number y value of accelerometer

Usage:

    y = yae.accelerometer.getY!
getZ ()
Get current Z relative to the center of earth

Returns:

    number z value of accelerometer

Usage:

    z = yae.accelerometer.getZ!
getRotation ()
Get current X, Y and Z relative to the center of earth

Returns:

  1. number x value of accelerometer
  2. number y value of accelerometer
  3. number z value of accelerometer

Usage:

    x, y, z = yae.accelerometer.getRotation!
isAvailable ()
Checks if accelerometer is available on current device

Returns:

    bool True if accelerometer is available

Usage:

    available = yae.accelerometer.isAvailable!
